title: Epilogue

dialogue.speaker: Sothe
dialogue.line: Well, I guess this is over. We'd better be on our way.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Are you going back to Daein?

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: Yes. Everyone's waiting for us.

dialogue.speaker: Sothe
dialogue.line: We have to start rebuilding all over again. Hopefully, this will be the last time.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Don't say "hopefully." Make it the last time. If anyone can do it, you two can.

dialogue.speaker: Sothe
dialogue.line: I don't doubt it. But thanks for the vote of confidence.

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: Thank you, Ike. I won't ever forget you.

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: But that's... I don't believe you! Because, see, my dear, you have the mark! Wait. Don't you have a mark?

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: No, Mother. Lady Almehda, is that the reason you thought me to be your son?

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: And that is the reason why Izuka chose me out of all the children at that orphanage.

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: Stop! This is impossible! You are my son. I am your mother, and I say so!

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: Lady Almedha, your only memories of your son were of him as a baby. You yourself said so. In other words, he already had a mark, even as a child.

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: Yes, that's so. What of it?

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: This mark--my mark, here--is called the "Spirits' Protection." When I was thirteen, I chose to make a pact with the spirits.

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: What?!

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: When I learned that you were one of the dragon clan, I began to doubt. And slowly my doubt turned to certainty. I'm sorry, Lady Almedha. I'm sorry that, though it was never my intent, I ended up deceiving you. I'm sorry, but I am not your son.

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: P-Pelleas...

dialogue.speaker: Pelleas
dialogue.line: But still... I was happy. It was fleeting, but... I knew the feeling of a mother's love. You have my thanks.

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: I... Ah...sniff...

dialogue.speaker: Caineghis
dialogue.line: Ah, Ike. Your work out there was superb.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Hey, you aren't quite over the hill yet yourself. You know, I always wanted to go one-on-one with you, just once.

dialogue.speaker: Caineghis
dialogue.line: Hah. I would have expected you'd had your fill of fighting.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: I've had enough of kill-or-be-killed to last me a lifetime. But something simpler, some way of testing our respective strengths...

dialogue.speaker: Caineghis
dialogue.line: You mean controlled matches, with all the little rules they have. In a peaceful world, we need such things. Especially we laguz. Without a fight now and then, we go a bit strange in the head.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: That's the honest truth. I'd rather try to order a river to change course than stop a bunch of rampaging laguz!

dialogue.speaker: Sanaki
dialogue.line: Wait... Sister!

dialogue.speaker: Sanaki
dialogue.line: You're my older sister, aren't you?

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: What do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: Sanaki
dialogue.line: It makes sense. All the pieces fit. The galdr of release... The goddess Yune's voice...

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: It's true. Inside the tower, I heard the voices of many hearts, and I knew. I am descended from Lehran and Altina. Misaha, the former apostle, was my grandmother.

dialogue.speaker: Sanaki
dialogue.line: Yes, I thought so. In that case, my sister, please consider staying in Begnion. With your power and charisma, you could do so much good here.

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: No, I'm afraid I can't.

dialogue.speaker: Sanaki
dialogue.line: Wh-why not?

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: Daein is my home, and Daein needs me to help it heal and rebuild. Not Begnion.

dialogue.speaker: Sanaki
dialogue.line: But Begnion--

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: Begnion has you, Empress. You will be a just ruler. Make your country proud to have you.

dialogue.speaker: Sanaki
dialogue.line: Will I...never see you again?

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: Hardly. I think that what our countries need now is a sense of family and friendship. I ask that you sign a treaty of alliance with Daein and announce that we are equals.

dialogue.speaker: Sanaki
dialogue.line: I will! Of course! Once things settle down in both of our countries, that will be the first thing I do...Sister!

dialogue.speaker: Micaiah
dialogue.line: Thank you, Empress Sanaki. ...My dear little sister.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Will you be heading back to Gallia first?

dialogue.speaker: Tibarn
dialogue.line: We'll stop by Gallia, then wing straight on to Serenes.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Serenes? Why there?

dialogue.speaker: Reyson
dialogue.line: The Empress Sanaki has kept her promise. Serenes will be formally ceded back to us. She said we may return immediately.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Ah, I see. That's good to hear.

dialogue.speaker: Tibarn
dialogue.line: Sometimes birds change their feathers. The hawks, the herons, even the ravens. We're thinking we'll all settle down together.

dialogue.speaker: Reyson
dialogue.line: All this time, we've sorted ourselves by our ways of thinking and seeing and living. If we can respect each other's opinions and learn to compromise, we can learn to live together without strife.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: I don't think it will be that easy, but it still ought to be simpler than getting beorc and laguz to treat each other decently. You set a good example, Reyson.

dialogue.speaker: Tibarn
dialogue.line: All the major issues look like they'll be handled soon. The only thing we can't agree on is hunting and eating meat.

dialogue.speaker: Reyson
dialogue.line: The forest creatures are off-limits! Needless displays of violence as well. You know we will not budge on that.

dialogue.speaker: Tibarn
dialogue.line: Tell me... Have you ever heard of a vegetarian hawk? Or a raptor that doesn't scream victoriously at the skies after a kill?

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Meat, huh? That's a thorny problem...

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: Well, Your Majesty. Shall we be off?

dialogue.speaker: Elincia
dialogue.line: Yes, let us. To Crimea. To our homeland.

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: You are Ike, of the Greil Mercenaries?

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: And you're the dowager queen of Daein. I heard some of what you've gone through. I'm glad that you're safe.

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: Ah, indeed.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: In light of that... Can I do anything for you?

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: I think not. I think I have seen enough.

dialogue.speaker: Ike
dialogue.line: As you wish. Well then, Lady Almedha, Prince Kurthnaga. Take care of yourselves.

dialogue.speaker: Kurthnaga
dialogue.line: Yes. And you as well. I know we shall meet again!

dialogue.speaker: Kurthnaga
dialogue.line: Are you satisfied, my sister? You wished so strongly to meet with General Ike.

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: I only did so because Pelleas said... He said that it would be wise if I were to meet with him.

dialogue.speaker: Kurthnaga
dialogue.line: Did he say why?

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: "That child," he said. It was the last gift he could give me. He wouldn't say anything more.

dialogue.speaker: Kurthnaga
dialogue.line: A gift? By meeting General Ike?

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: What about that beorc could possibly be... Wait... Ah! Wait! Wait, stop a moment!

dialogue.speaker: Kurthnaga
dialogue.line: Sister!?

dialogue.speaker: Soren
dialogue.line: Yes? You needed something?

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: You are... What is your name?

dialogue.speaker: Soren
dialogue.line: Soren.

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: I-I see. That...that is a fine name.

dialogue.speaker: Soren
dialogue.line: Thank you...?

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: You're welcome.

dialogue.speaker: Soren
dialogue.line: Is that all?

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: Ah, yes, yes. Pardon me. Calling out to you like that... I was confused.

dialogue.speaker: Soren
dialogue.line: Don't let it trouble you. If you'll excuse me.

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: I don't believe it.

dialogue.speaker: Kurthnaga
dialogue.line: That boy is the staff officer for the Greil Mercenaries. What made you call out to him like that?

dialogue.speaker: Kurthnaga
dialogue.line: Sister?

dialogue.speaker: Almedha
dialogue.line: Because I have lost the power of my birthright, I thought... Maybe I wouldn't be able to... That I might not be able to recognize my own child. But when her own true son stands before her, no mother could fail to know. Oh, my son, you've lived and grown strong.

dialogue.speaker: Kurthnaga
dialogue.line: You can't mean... Soren is your son?

dialogue.speaker: Lehran
dialogue.line: Welcome home.
Could it be that you were here all this time?

dialogue.speaker: Lehran
dialogue.line: Alas, no, I am sorry to say. But for several days, I've somehow felt as though you would soon return.

dialogue.speaker: Ashunera
dialogue.line: Well, I'm home. And I'm glad to see you again, Lehran.

dialogue.speaker: Lehran
dialogue.line: And I am glad to see you as well, Goddess Ashunera.

dialogue.speaker: Ashunera
dialogue.line: How long has it been? A hundred years? Five hundred?

dialogue.speaker: Lehran
dialogue.line: About twelve hundred years.

dialogue.speaker: Ashunera
dialogue.line: I see. For mortals, that is many, many lives.

dialogue.speaker: Lehran
dialogue.line: Yes. The peace we once had is on the verge of crumbling again.

dialogue.speaker: Ashunera
dialogue.line: That is unfortunate. The miasma of war is beginning to shroud the world. However, I shall not again be frightened. As one born of the hopes of man I shall protect this world.

dialogue.speaker: Lehran
dialogue.line: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: Ashunera
dialogue.line: Lehran. I've missed your songs. Would you sing for me now?

dialogue.speaker: Lehran
dialogue.line: I...I no longer...

dialogue.speaker: Ashunera
dialogue.line: Well, then I will sing. And you may sing with me. Is that all right?

dialogue.speaker: Lehran
dialogue.line: ...Yes.

narration: In days long past, a young man strode the lands of Tellius.

He was simple yet true, his deeds brave and noble. He reunited two races long at war, and healed the heart of a goddess long gone mad. Ask any you meet be they young or old, beorc or laguz, of a hero named Ike and you'll receive a warm smile and a tale or two of faith, courage, and honesty.
